intro: Nerophila senegambiensis, commonly known as the Senegambian lily, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has strap-like leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Its bulbs are also used for ornamental purposes due to their aesthetic appeal. Nerophila senegambiensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by supporting local pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
